stance_connections.node: High housing costs in San Francisco
stance_connections.explanation: High housing costs create a financial gap for middle-class earners, indicating a need for affordable housing options to bridge this gap.

stance_connections.node: High housing costs in San Francisco
stance_connections.explanation: High housing costs force essential workers to move out, suggesting a need for affordable housing to retain them in the city.

stance_connections.node: People who grew up in San Francisco now live far away and face daunting commutes
stance_connections.explanation: Long commutes due to unaffordable housing highlight the need for more housing development to allow residents to stay in the city.
Living in the community builds trust and allows for quick emergency responses, supporting housing for first responders within the communities they serve.
Bureaucratic hurdles and opposition make it difficult to build more housing, suggesting a need to streamline processes to facilitate development.
High costs drive essential workers out of the city, indicating a need for affordable housing to retain them and maintain city services.
Persistent homelessness despite housing availability suggests integrating addiction treatment with affordable housing policies.
